places.name: Frigorífico Anglo (UNESCO)
places.description: Historical industrial landscape, a UNESCO World Heritage site known as 'The Kitchen of the World'. Features the Museum of the Industrial Revolution.

places.name: UTEC - Universidad Tecnológica
places.description: A modern technological university located within the Anglo site, offering degrees in Mechatronics, IT, and other technical fields.

places.name: Balneario Las Cañas
places.description: A popular beach resort on the Uruguay River, offering camping, cabins, and water activities, perfect for family tourism.

places.name: Paso de las Piedras
places.description: A tranquil natural area ideal for fishing, birdwatching, and enjoying the serene rural landscape of Río Negro.

places.name: Plaza Constitución
places.description: The main square of Fray Bentos, a vibrant meeting point surrounded by historical buildings and local shops, often hosts events.

places.name: Museo Solari
places.description: A museum dedicated to the renowned Uruguayan artist Luis Solari, showcasing his unique works and contributions to art.

places.name: Parque Roosevelt
places.description: Although in a neighboring department, this large park offers recreational facilities, green spaces, and a zoo, popular with Río Negro residents.

places.name: Bodega Los Cerros de San Juan
places.description: A historic winery offering tours and tastings, representing Uruguay's rich winemaking tradition, a popular day trip from Río Negro.
